name: mango production, conditioned, wax treatment | mango, conditioned | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20102/documentation

This dataset represents the post-harvest phase of the mango produced in the San Francisco valley, Northeast of Brazil and consumed in the local market and as well as exported to several countries. The processes included are: washing of the mango,application of wax and fungicides. It is considered a loss of 5% of the mangoes - those that do not comply with quality requirements and are discarded. Effluent from washes and phytosanitary treatments is disposed in soil without treatment, and it is assumed that all inputs of detergents and chemicals are released in the effluent.;Products and suppliers: https://www.agro.bayer.com.br/produtos/serenade https://www.lamotte-oils.de/en/products/product-range/a/si/p/carnauba-wax.html http://www.aamtech.com.au/pdf/msds/Septone%20Mango%20Wash.pdf http://www.portaldistribuidora.com/fichas/INDEBA/Primmax%20DGA.pdf https://www.ultracleansystems.com/trays-detergents-accessories/ultra-clean-systems-detergents/ http://www.mercoclean.com.br/produtos/alimentos-e-bebidas/produtos-especificos/letah-gel/ http://www.echeverriasa.cl/Fichas/FT-FICHAS/FT-TECSA%20CLOR.pdf;http://www2.amazonas.com.br/segmentos/embalagens/produtos/hot-melt-hotmelt http://www.internationalpaper.com/products/south-america/corrugated-packaging/product-detail/produce-packaging http://www.madeireirabaggio.com.br/ http://www.arckpack.com.br/

The activity starts when the harvested mangoes are brought to the packing house.

The dataset includes inputs of chemical products, packaging material, water, electricity and the production of the infrastruture and industrial machines. Are not included in the dataset the inputs of packaging material used in the finished product (conditioned mangoes), however this has been accounted as the following (per quilogram of packed mango): Cardboard used in the boxes 2.30E-04 kg ; Eucalyptus wood in the form of pallets 7.44E-04kg; Plastic tape 3.25E-08kg, and Hotmelt adhesive (EVA) 7.67E-04 kg. Also, the wax used for coating the mangoes has not been added to the exchanges, since the LCI of Carnauba wax from Brazil is not yet available on the database, which corresponds to 8.33E-03kg of Carnauba wax per kg of packed mango.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for the San Francisco valley, states of Pernambuco and Bahia, Brazil, the main producer region, and extrapolated at country level.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Exchange properties such as carbon content, water content, dry mass and wet mass are based on ecoinvent database.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data regarding inputs where given by the local producers; some measurements where made in the packing house, regarding water flows during the washes. Electricity spendings where taking from energy bills at the packaging unit.

exchanges.description: Final product - mango after quality control (discart of 5%) and wax and fungicide application. Average Packed fruits (years 2012 to 2016) is 8,98E+06 kg per year, according to producers in the packing house visited. However, 39% of this ammount goes to the countries that require the heat water tretment and (100-39)= 61% to the markets that do nor require heat treatment.

exchanges.description: Total quantity of steel in the machines used. For 20,000 fruits/hour the equipment weight is 1500 kg of steel (http://www.cemag.com.br/s_produtos_detalhes.asp?id=48). The inventoried packaging unit process 8,980,000 kg of mango/year, resulting in 4,677 fruits/hour. Considering that mangos are packed all year long and that the equipment last 30 years, the ammount of 11,7 kg of steel/year is consumed.

exchanges.description: Packing house area = 600 m2 for 30 years of mango processing. The packing house process per year 8980000kg of mangoes. Since (100-39)% of the mangos do not receive water heat treatment and this inventory is for these mangoes - the ones that receive only wax treatment, we considered that 61% of the packing house area is for mangoes not receiving heat treatment.
